c. d. gibson.gloss: United States illustrator remembered for his creation of the `Gibson girl' (1867-1944)

c. diphtheriae.gloss: a species of bacterium that causes diphtheria

cd.gloss: a soft bluish-white ductile malleable toxic bivalent metallic element
the basic unit of luminous intensity adopted under the Systeme International d'Unites
a debt instrument issued by a bank
a digitally encoded recording on an optical disk that is smaller than a phonograph record
being one hundred more than three hundred

cd-r.gloss: a compact disc on which you can write only once and thereafter is read-only memory

cd-rom.gloss: a compact disk that is used with a computer (rather than with an audio system)

cd-wo.gloss: a compact disc on which you can write only once and thereafter is read-only memory

cd4.gloss: a glycoprotein that is found primarily on the surface of helper T cells

cd4 cell.gloss: T cell with CD4 receptor that recognizes antigens on the surface of a virus-infected cell and secretes lymphokines that stimulate B cells and killer T cells

cd4 t cell.gloss: T cell with CD4 receptor that recognizes antigens on the surface of a virus-infected cell and secretes lymphokines that stimulate B cells and killer T cells

cd8.gloss: a membrane glycoprotein that is found primarily on the surface of cytotoxic T cells

cd8 cell.gloss: T cell with CD8 receptor that recognizes antigens on the surface of a virus-infected cell and binds to the infected cell and kill it

cd8 t cell.gloss: T cell with CD8 receptor that recognizes antigens on the surface of a virus-infected cell and binds to the infected cell and kill it

cd burner.gloss: recording equipment for making compact disks

cdc.gloss: a federal agency in the Department of Health and Human Services

synonyms.word: center for disease control and prevention

cdna.gloss: single-stranded DNA that is complementary to messenger RNA or DNA that has been synthesized from messenger RNA by reverse transcriptase
